answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some resources that might be a helpful start.
This report by the Center for Governmental Research looks into the feasibility of the Town and Village of Cobleskill, NY merging.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/301854
A similar study examines whether East Windsor and Hightstown, NJ should merge.
icma.org/Documents/QuestionAnswer/Document/8886  
The Town of Princeton will merge with the Borough of Princeton, NJ.
http://www.businessweek.com/news/2011-11-10/two-princeton-towns-in-new-jersey-vote-to-merge-governments.html
Westerly, RI is planning to combine the positions of School Solicitor and Town Solicitor merging the financial departments.
http://www.thewesterlysun.com/news/article_f0b404a2-338f-11e0-b379-001cc4c03286.html 
Boca Raton, Delray Beach and Boynton Beach, FL have considered combining their police and fire-rescue dispatch teams.
http://articles.sun-sentinel.com/2011-07-05/news/fl-boca-joint-dispatch-20110704_1_consolidated-dispatch-dispatch-merger-dispatch-center
Louisville County and Jefferson County, KY merged in 2003 and have found the merger to be successful.
http://www.louisvilleky.gov/YourGovernment/Merger.htm
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Michael Lombardo
text: The Town of Hamilton, MA has several joint programs with the neighboring Town of Wenham.  A recent opportunity has presented itself for the Town's to merge the two Finance Departments into a single department, expanding capabiltiies and functionality for both Town's.  Is anyone aware of other jurisdictions that have merged their Finance Departments...I am aware ofwhat the Unified Gov't of Wyandotte County/Kansas City and Charlotte-Mecklenburg have done are there other examples?  Also interested in examples where two jurisdictions have completely merged...
title: Merging Towns/Finance Departments
